concept.title: About Editor Views
concept.shortdesc: Information in each session is displayed in a series of small windows within the Session Editor, called views. There are several types of views:

ol.li:
Views with access/reference to the entire session:
Session Information
Tier Management

Views with information relating to individual records:
Record Data
Syllabification & Alignment
IPA Validation

Views with media functions:
Media Player
Speech Analysis (formally Waveform)
Segmentation

Views that allow you to search for text within a session:
Find & Replace

Utility views which help with IPA transcription:
IPA Lookup

conbody.p: To open a view, select it from the View menu. Functions for open views are available both within the views themselves, and in the View menu. To close a view, click the Close/X in the top right corner of that viewor choose the View <view title> Close menu selection.
Not all views must be open at any given time, and views may be moved around within the Session Editor or "undocked" as their own separate window.
Views retain their currently defined size and position each time you exit Phon.
